channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-6396] Fix NoSuchMethodError running against hadoop 2.0
item.description:
HADOOP-8350 changed the signature of NetUtils.getInputStream()
This leads to NoSuchMethodError in HBaseClient$Connection.setupIOstreams().

See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-8350?focusedCommentId=13414276&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13414276

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Patch allows TestPBOnWritableRpc to pass against hadoop 2.0

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12536508/6396.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 javac. The applied patch generated 5 javac compiler warnings (more than the trunk's current 4 warnings).

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 8 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.TestForceCacheImportantBlocks

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2387//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2387//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2387//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2387//console

This message is automatically generated.

This is only a problem when running HBase compiled against Hadoop-1 on Hadoop-2, right?
I think we have more cases where it is required to build HBase against Hadoop-2 if it is meant to be run against Hadoop-2.

I first saw this error from the following thread:
http://search-hadoop.com/m/MeBkIxlDj52/Hive+and+CDH4+GA&subj=Hive+and+CDH4+GA

I put my suggestion on HADOOP-8350 as to how impact for downstream projects can be minimized.

But the cast is safe to have regardless of how HADOOP-8350 is implemented.

I used the following commands to verify patch v2:


mvn clean compile

nohup mvn help:active-profiles -Dhadoop.profile=2.0 test > ../suite.txt &

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12536518/6396-v2.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 javac. The applied patch generated 5 javac compiler warnings (more than the trunk's current 4 warnings).

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 9 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2388//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2388//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2388//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2388//console

This message is automatically generated.
I liked v1 better. So this is an issue even if HBase is built against Hadoop-2?
I ran into this on HBase 0.94.1rc0. We didn't run into on the 0.94.0 version because I tested against the lastest hadoop 0.23 inseate of hadoop 2.0.
This problem existed against Hbase 0.94.0 untop of hadoop-2.0.0-cdh4.0.1.
+1 to commit to trunk and 0.94 branch. Thanks Ted.
Strange that I do not see this problem as long as I build 0.94 against Hadoop-2.
That is strange. Is this a case of building with one profile active but running/testing with another Jon?

Andrew, might be - I've been building 0.94 with the 23 profile but running on top of a hadoop 2 installation. With Ted's patch, it seems the shell works but the master web interface gets the exn still. I'm digging further.
Generally we're getting into muddy waters here I think. In some cases we abstract Hadoop versions away with reflection, in other cases HBase needs to be build with a specific hadoop profile.
What do you think Lars, err on the side of reflection here?

Clarification: the goal of the patch was not to make build compiled against hadoop 1 to work against hadoop 2.
The goal is to make build against 0.23 profile work with hadoop 2.

Since 0.92, we've needed to recompile – this is due to some classes that became interfaces, and an enum that got moved and "brought" back in via inheritance. These changes let client code source-compatible but not binary compatible – it required re-compilation.

Since 0.21, 0.22, and 0.23 is basically deprecated by hadoop 1.0 and 2.0, I'm leaning towards just having 0.94 support 1.0.x and 2.0.x hadoops. (does anyone really run or test this against 0.22 or 0.21?) I'll post a question on the mailing lists.

@Andy and @Jon: I think it should be one way or the other. Can we support Hadoop 1.0.x and Hadoop 2.0.x with just reflection? That would be preferable, but it seems we cannot.
@Ted: I'd rather add a Hadoop 2.0.x profile (which is in fact what I did when I built 0.94 for Hadoop 2)
@Lars, not yet, but trunk is evolving such that we can move code sections implemented as reflection into version specific implementations guarded by Maven profiles.

@Lars, idealy yeah. Actually, in this case where we have "source-compatible" changes from hdfs that require recompile, I'd rather not use reflection - we'd need to run the whole test suite to catch cross-version problems instead of just doing the compile check that currently happens. (+1 hadoop23 compile check added to the hadoopqa script).

I created a hadoop 2.0 profile in my local and compiled everything against hadoop 2.0 jars instead of hadoop 0.23.x jars. This build didn't include this patch, and seems to have gotten past where the other build got stuck. With Ted's patch, my guess is that the reflection trick caught one place but that there are others in the source where the trick needed to be done again.

I second the idea of adding a hadoop 2.0 profile, and possibly dropping hadoop 0.23, 0.21 build support (but keep 0.22 is being used by Ted's crew). Bottom line, this patch isn't really needed for hadoop 2.0. I'm not sure if this patch is needed with 0.22 hadoops – it would be up to folks using that to vet it there.

We need to control this special casing / version combinatorics. I do not think we should "officially" support a Hadoop != 1.0 && 2.0 in our project build and test procedures. Shops running specialty versions can fix up our artifacts as needed, IMO.

we can move code sections implemented as reflection into version specific implementations guarded by Maven profiles.

Big +1 on this.

I do not think we should "officially" support a Hadoop != 1.0 && 2.0 in our project build and test procedures.

+1 on this too.

I second the idea of adding a hadoop 2.0 profile

Should I file a different jira to add the 2.0 profile to 0.94?

Should I file a different jira to add the 2.0 profile to 0.94?

+1. Let's add a 2.0 profile to 0.94 (and to 0.92 while we are at it).

As for removing other versions, let's let the poll I posted cook a day or two.

I agree that we do hadoop 1.0.x and 2.0.x only, officially. You going to write the dev list Jon w/ proposal we can all pile on? Stick in there too your finding that we need recompile if doing hadoop1 vs hadoop2 (maybe we'll not need it going forward w/ the hadoop specific modules we now have and some hackery in hadoop-env.sh)
I posted a poll this morning,http://markmail.org/thread/av7n4ketilcbvsxq
Pardon me Jon. I see it now.
Filed HBASE-6426
We should close this as "Won't fix" then?
Any objection to Stack's suggestion of marking this won't fix?
Resolving as won't fix. Please reopen if I have it wrong.
